Hello Kerbanauts, I thought I should make some sort of hello post before too long, so here goes;

Hello.

Well I think that went swimmingly ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

p.s. is there a method to measure degrees, or derive them, of the angle between two space craft who are both in circular orbits around the same object. Since I can\'t think how and its making rendezvous quite difficult. I\'d prefer a method without addons/plugins but if thats the only way it\'d work then ok.

Happy launchings!

Arr,

Captain Kerbalnaut

Community manager

Ignore the imposters.

Welcome to the KSP Forums!

Happy Launching!

Arrr!

Capt\'n Skunky

KSP Community Manager

> 
> p.s. is there a method to measure degrees, or derive them, of the angle between two space craft who are both in circular orbits around the same object. Since I can\'t think how and its making rendezvous quite difficult. I\'d prefer a method without addons/plugins but if thats the only way it\'d work then ok.

The only ways I know involve too much math to be useful in game. You\'d have to calculate relative speed of the faster object to the slower one (as a fraction of the orbital distance over time), relative altitude, and that\'d give you a relation of angle over time via trig.
